messages.title: Retirement should be a time of relaxation and enjoyment
messages.content: Retirement should be a time of relaxation and enjoyment - a reward for a lifetime of work, and for many, bringing up children.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Roger Godsiff promises to pensioners: 1. Abolition of fixed compulsory retirement ages. 2. Link restoration between basic state pension and earnings by 2012. 3. Comprehensive National Care Scheme establishment. 4. Greater recognition and support for carers. 5. Opposition to phasing out of cheques.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have always put the interests of my constituents first - as my voting record in parliament shows - and I will honour these pledges.

quotes.text: 17 million - almost 30% of the population - are over the age of 55. In later life people want to age with dignity and financial security as a reward for their lifelong contributions to society. They do not want to be penalised for saving and planning ahead.

images.caption: Roger speaking in a debate in Parliament
Image of two elderly people suggesting a comfortable retirement

leaflet.additionalNotes: These are my promises to pensioners.
